fr.sorbonne_u.components.cyphy.plugins.devs.interfaces

Interface SimulatorCI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.ComponentInterface, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.OfferedCI, java.rmi.Remote, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimulatorConnector, SimulatorInboundPort, SimulatorOutboundPort

    public interface SimulatorCI
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.OfferedCI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI
    The component interface SimulatorCI declares the core behaviour of DEVS simulation engines.

    Description

    This component interface is based on the corresponding Java interface SimulatorI defined by the DEVS simulation library to declare the methods used by coordination engines to implement the DEVS simulation protocol and some other library-dependent associated methods.

    This component interface is not made extending (in the Java sense) the corresponding Java interface first because RMI forces to add exceptions thrown by the RMI protocol but also because not all methods in the Java interface are needed when calling simulators through BCM4Java component connections. Especially, the methods in the interface SimulationManagementI are treated in the component interface SimulationManagementCI to avoid requiring in simulation supervisors the full simulator interface but only the simulation management one.

    Black-box Invariant

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2018-06-13

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean allModelVariablesInitialised()
      return true if all model variables are fully initialised (relevant for HIOA models).
      boolean allModelVariablesTimeInitialised()
      return true if all model variables have their associated time initialised (relevant for HIOA models).
      void endSimulation(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Time endTime)
      terminate the current simulation, doing the necessary catering tasks.
      void externalEventStep(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration elapsedTime)
      process an external input event at a simulated time which must correspond to the current value of the global simulated time clock at the time of the call i.e., the sum of the time of the last event in this engine and the given elapsed time.
      fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.utils.Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> fixpointInitialiseVariables()
      initialise the model variables with a more elaborated protocol when external model variables depend of each others, hence models importing variables have to wait until these variables are themselves initialised so this protocol will allow to call repetitively the method until all variables are initialised without having to respect any order among models (but models cannot have circular dependencies); this method must be called after the method initialiseState.
      fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration getNextTimeAdvance()
      return the duration until the next internal event as previously computed by timeAdvance().
      fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Time getTimeOfLastEvent()
      return the time of occurrence of the last event.
      fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Time getTimeOfNextEvent()
      return the currently forecast time of occurrence of the next event.
      boolean hasDebugLevel(int debugLevel)
      true if the current debug level is equal to debugLevel, false otherwise.
      void initialiseSimulation(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration simulationDuration)
      initialise the simulation engine for a run with a time of start set to 0; for runs that will be stopped by a call to stopSimulation, the duration can be set to infinity.
      void initialiseSimulation(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Time simulationStartTime, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration simulationDuration)
      initialise the simulation engine for a run with a time of start set to the given time; for runs that will be stopped by a call to stopSimulation, the duration can be set to infinity.
      void internalEventStep()
      process the next internal event by advancing the simulation time to the forecast time of occurrence of this and then do the transition to the next state in the corresponding simulation model.
      boolean isDebugModeOn()
      return true if the debug level is greater than 0.
      boolean isParentSet()
      return true if the parent simulation engine of this engine is set.
      boolean isSimulationInitialised()
      return true if the simulation has been initialised for a run.
      void produceOutput(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Time current)
      force the model to forward externals event generated before their next internal transition step.
      void setDebugLevel(int debugLevel)
      set the debug level.
      void setParent(java.lang.String parentNotificationInboundPortURI)
      set the parent simulation engine of this engine to c.
      void showCurrentState(java.lang.String indent, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration elapsedTime)
      print the current state.
      void showCurrentStateContent(java.lang.String indent, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration elapsedTime)
      print the content of the current state, without pre- and post-formatting.
      java.lang.String simulatorAsString()
      return the simulator information as a string.
      void toggleDebugMode()
      activate the lowest debug level or deactivate the debug mode completely.
      boolean useFixpointInitialiseVariables()
      return true if the model uses the fixpoint algorithm to initialise its model variables, false otherwise; when true, the method fixpointInitialiseVariables must be implemented by the model, and when false, it is the method initialiseVariables that must be.

 pre     simulationDuration.getTimeUnit().equals(getSimulatedTimeUnit())
 pre     simulationDuration.greaterThan(Duration.zero(getSimulatedTimeUnit()))
 pre     isModelSet()
 pre     !isSimulationInitialised()
 post    isSimulationInitialised()
        Parameters:
        simulationDuration - duration of the simulation to be launched.
        Throws:

                   throws java.lang.Exception
        initialise the simulation engine for a run with a time of start set to the given time; for runs that will be stopped by a call to stopSimulation, the duration can be set to infinity.

 pre     simulationStartTime.getTimeUnit().equals(getSimulatedTimeUnit())
 pre     simulationStartTime.greaterThanOrEqual(Time.zero(getSimulatedTimeUnit()))
 pre     simulationDuration != null
 pre     simulationDuration.getTimeUnit().equals(getSimulatedTimeUnit())
 pre     simulationDuration.greaterThan(Duration.zero(getSimulatedTimeUnit()))
 pre     isModelSet()
 pre     !isSimulationInitialised()
 post    isSimulationInitialised()
        Parameters:
        simulationStartTime - time at which the simulation must start.
        simulationDuration - duration of the simulation to be launched.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
        See Also:

                                throws java.lang.Exception

      • fixpointInitialiseVariables

        fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.utils.Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> fixpointInitialiseVariables()
                                                                                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        initialise the model variables with a more elaborated protocol when external model variables depend of each others, hence models importing variables have to wait until these variables are themselves initialised so this protocol will allow to call repetitively the method until all variables are initialised without having to respect any order among models (but models cannot have circular dependencies); this method must be called after the method initialiseState.

        Contract

         pre     useFixpointInitialiseVariables()
 pre     allModelVariablesTimeInitialised()
 post    ret.getFirst() >= 0 && ret.getSecond() >= 0
 post    !(ret.getFirst() >= 0 || ret.getSecond() == 0) || allModelVariablesInitialised()
        Returns:
        a pair which first element is the number of newly initialised variables (i.e.) and the second the number of non initialised yet variables.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
        See Also:
        VariableInitialisationI.fixpointInitialiseVariables()

      • internalEventStep

        void internalEventStep()
                throws java.lang.Exception
        process the next internal event by advancing the simulation time to the forecast time of occurrence of this and then do the transition to the next state in the corresponding simulation model.

        Contract

         pre     isSimulationInitialised()
 pre     getNextTimeAdvance().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract(getTimeOfLastEvent()))
 post    getNextTimeAdvance().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract(getTimeOfLastEvent()))
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
        See Also:
        SimulatorI.internalEventStep()

      • externalEventStep

        void externalEventStep(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration elapsedTime)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        process an external input event at a simulated time which must correspond to the current value of the global simulated time clock at the time of the call i.e., the sum of the time of the last event in this engine and the given elapsed time.

        The processing first cancel the previously forecast internal event if any and then make the transition to a new model state given the processed external event and then forecast a new internal event.

        Contract

         pre     elapsedTime != null
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - time elapsed since the last event executed by this engine.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
        See Also:
        SimulatorI.externalEventStep(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration)

      • produceOutput

        void produceOutput(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Time current)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        force the model to forward externals event generated before their next internal transition step.

        The implementation follows the principle of the "peer message exchanging implementation" of DEVS i.e., the simulators exchanges directly with each others the exported and imported events without passing through their parent (and ancestors).

        Contract

         pre     current != null
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        current - current simulation time at which external events may be output.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
        See Also:
        SimulatorI.produceOutput(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Time)
